clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: Re-engage with your database, especially during the holidays. This is the time to push on the gas and do a lot of marketing.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Carrie speaks like a seasoned coach—direct, no-fluff, grounded in decades of market cycles. She uses conversational phrases ('you know') but delivers tactical wisdom with quiet confidence.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It flips the conventional wisdom that Q4 is 'coast mode' and reveals what top producers do while everyone else is checking out.

HOOK.text: Most agents are about to make a $50,000 mistake.
HOOK.production_note: Bold text overlay on dark background. Cut to Carrie mid-sentence, serious expression.

SETUP.text: They're taking their foot off the gas in Q4. Letting their database go cold. Waiting for January. Carrie McCormick—who's closed over $300 million in Chicago—says that's exactly backwards.
SETUP.production_note: B-roll: Calendar flipping to November/December. Cut to Carrie's credentials on screen. Then back to her speaking.

INSIGHT.text: Here's what she does instead: 'Re-engage with your database, especially during the holidays. This is the time to push on the gas and do a lot of marketing.' Why? Because rates just dropped to 6%. Anyone who bought during the pandemic has equity. And they're not terrified of giving up their 3% rate anymore. While everyone else is coasting, you're calling past clients saying: 'Let's re-appraise your place. What's it worth? Do you want to move?' That's how you set up 2026 in November.
INSIGHT.production_note: Split screen: Carrie speaking + animated text highlighting key phrases ('push on the gas,' '6% rates,' 're-appraise'). Show phone/CRM interface mockup during 'calling past clients' line.

REFRAME.text: Think about it: Your competition is watching football and planning vacations. You're having conversations that turn into February listings. The agents who win Q1 are the ones who worked Q4.
REFRAME.production_note: Contrast visual: Split screen showing 'typical agent' (couch, remote) vs 'you' (laptop, phone, working). End on Carrie nodding.

CTA.text: So here's your homework: Pull your list of everyone who bought between 2020 and 2022. Send them a market update this week. One conversation could be your entire January. Don't wait.
CTA.production_note: Text overlay: 'Pull your 2020-2022 buyers. Send market update THIS WEEK.' End card with Carrie's name and episode link.

caption: While everyone's coasting into the holidays, top producers are setting up their 2026. Here's the Q4 play most agents miss.
